intro: Virgulaster, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plants typically have opposite, simple leaves and produce small, clustered flowers with four to five petals. The fruits are usually berries or drupes, containing one or more seeds. Virgulaster species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and flowering habits.
